title: LinkedIn Agent
subtitle: Building an Agent that Turned Networking from 2-Hour Daily Grinds into Strategic Outreach
content:
If you are building your network on Linkedin, I'm guessing you have to find potential connections, manually write or copy paste a cold connection request and hope the void responds back to you.

I was miserable doing this, so I decided to change the workflow by building a Linkedin Agent to help me send connection requests, analyze patterns and turn a joyless process into a quick process which gets me exposure and opportunities to connect with people at scale.

[GitHub Repo](https://github.com/nikhilkulkarni1755/linkedin-agent/)

## The Agent

 Connect with multiple people in the same job title. You may want to find out what being a hardware engineer at Boston Dynamics is like, or you may want to ask a specific question to forward deployed engineers at a frontier lab.

 If you want to get in front of Recruiters from a specific company, this method will list out lots of possible connections.

You can personalize the message, so that your message and personality comes through.

## Tools Built for the Agent

### 1. Find and Connect to Professionals
- Given parameters like Company, Title, City, State and exclude University Recruiter? to help you connect to as many people who fit the archetype.
- Use {first_name} to make sure your message is customized! ex - 'Hey {first_name}, heard about the difficult interview process at Substack Engineering, any tips?'

### 2. Analytics
- All tool calls are logged locally. Easy to see results (5% connection rate vs 10% connection rate) and experiment to find winning patterns.

### 3. Confirmation
- All LLM tool calls ask for confirmation before executing. Man in the middle is always good to add for users.

## The Mindset

Using this tool is not meant for building personal (very warm connections). This is meant to find possible connections between strangers...
